description: French cognac, from Cognac, a city in France, from Medieval Latin Comniacum, from the name Cominius + Gallo-Roman suffix -acum, from Proto-Celtic *-ƒÅkom.

entries.meaning: A brandy distilled from white wine in the region around Cognac in France.
examples: Major manufacturers add a small proportion of caramel to color their cognacs.
